Abstersæ lacrymæ, The poet buffoon'd, or, A vindication of the unfortunate ladies from the sawcy reflections in a late doggrel satyr against the famous lottery in Freemans-yard by a club of the fair sex for that purpose assembled. Club of the Fair Sex.
[2], 7 [i.e. 1]-10 p.
Printed and are to be sold by Randal Taylor, London : 1694.
In verse. Reproduction of original in Harvard University Libraries.
=======
